message.content:
We need to “calculate the final sales expenses item” on the income statement by summing up all the “Sales Expenses” transactions. In our provided data the sales expenses are recorded on lines whose “type” is exactly “Sales Expenses.” One may ignore the other expense lines (such as “Administrative Expenses” or “Financial Expenses”). 

Below is our step‐by‐step review of the “Sales Expenses” lines and their amounts (we use the recorded_amount column):

1. Expense20240101001 | Sales Expenses → 912.25  
2. Expense20240102001 | Sales Expenses → 593.54  
3. Expense20240102001 | Sales Expenses → 742.01  
4. Expense20240103001 | Sales Expenses → 619.55  
5. Expense20240103001 | Sales Expenses → 911.56

19. Expense20240128001 | Sales Expenses → 593.98

21. Expense20240130001 | Sales Expenses → 864.48  
22. Expense20240201001 | Sales Expenses → 531.77  
23. Expense20240203001 | Sales Expenses → 578.63  
24. Expense20240205001 | Sales Expenses (first row) → 703.14  
25. Expense20240205001 | Sales Expenses (second row) → 991.65  

Now we sum these values step by step:

• 912.25  
+ 593.54 = 1505.79  
+ 742.01 = 2247.80  
+ 619.55 = 2867.35  
+ 911.56 = 3778.91  
+ 505.90 = 4284.81  
+ 467.46 = 4752.27  
+ 100.60 = 4852.87

+ 128.65 = 9008.74  
+ 790.94 = 9799.68  
+ 438.39 = 10238.07  
+ 593.98 = 10832.05  
+ 212.96 = 11045.01  
+ 864.48 = 11909.49  
+ 531.77 = 12441.26  
+ 578.63 = 13019.89  
+ 703.14 = 13723.03  
+ 991.65 = 14714.68  

Thus the final “Sales Expenses” total is 14714.68.

Accordingly, the final answer expected for “Selling Expenses” in the income statement is:

--------------------------------------------------

{
  "solution": {
    "Selling Expenses": "14714.68"
  }
}
